review: We've come to this location twice in the last month because we received a gift card. Both times we had a bad experience. The first time the server took about 20 minutes to realize we were there, finally the manager came by and took our drink order. After a long wait we ordered and waited an even longer time to receive our meals. My meal was wrong so I had to send it back. My fiance was basically done with his meal by the time mine came. The manager gave me my meal for free and was very apologetic.  Our second visit, today for dinner, went at the same slow pace. We were seated right away, typical for a Monday night, but our waiter was very slow in taking down our drink order. There were three other parties seated around us, two of the parties had to flag someone down to ask for a server. I overheard the server two of the parties they were out of something, and we were told as well they were out of an appetizer. Luckily we were in no hurry for both occasions so the slow service wasn't too big of an inconvenience to us. What topped our disappointing visit was that we gave our waiter our gift card and enough cash to cover the rest of the bill that we owed. He took about 10 minutes to run our gift card and process our payment, so we thought he was doing. He handed us the bill back along with the gift card and cash and thanked us for coming. Not sure if he got us confused with another table, or didn't even run the card. This server should be thankful that my fiance and I are honest people. I could easily see someone taking the cash and gift card back and just walking out.  The way I see it with this location is that they either need to hire new people with experience or do a lot more training. The lack of experience at this location is giving them a bad name.  Definitely won't be returning to this location any time soon.

today i visited TGI Fridays for a late lunch our sever Jeremy was great fast and attentive. her took great care of us even the manager came by our table to see how we were doing. i will come back to this restaurant.
Our waitress was great! But, I have been here on the weekends, when service is slow. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs and lobster- it was great!
The food was just okay, the hostess was rude and the waitress was over worked.  I won't be going back.

Unfortunately this wasn't the best location of TGIF i have been to. Before i get to the bad parts, the caesar salad was good and they have the most amazing breadsticks! The part that wasn't great was the chicken bruschetta pasta, which looked amazing. The pasta came out about cold and and it was not anywhere close to amazing. Definitely a let down. The service was also a little slow. Cheap menu but not worth it. Not this location..I also would like to point out that when we couldn't find the drink menu the waitress didn't know where it was, so she named a few beers they had but forgot the rest on the menu. When we did receive our drinks she accidentally spilled the water on my menu/table. not cool! -_- (Now i am editing my review after i just finished.) Turns out i had just got a call from my boyfriend who paid for our dinner last night. TGIF charged $260.00 on his card for this $26.00 meal. Looks like now i definitely will not be coming back here. Really poor service for a place that wasn't even busy. These waiters need to pay attention to these kind of things.. Not acceptable and i will be lowering the 2 stars to 1 now. :/
I Totally Recommend this restaurant. the food was good, the service was excellent and everyone there is really friendly and fast. I will defitnetly go back!!
Food was average. Slow service and waiter forgot items requested and substitutions.

I love their happy hour! Have been here many many times, experienced a few slow, not very good servers, but overall ive had only good experiences! Check in on foursquare too.. ive gotten a free appetizer and working on my free dessert :)
Food was what you would expect, but the service is awful!!!!  They got our order wrong, disappeared numerous times and never cleared a single plate.

I used to go to Fridays' all the time and loved the staff, food, and service. Last night was my first time frequenting this particular location and I can tell you I will not be back. Service was extremely slow and they don't have the excuse of being busy because we were one of only a few couples in there.  We got breadsticks which were so bland that I had to practically beg for something to dip them into for flavor. The ribs were overcooked and mushy. The only positive thing on my plate were the sweet potato fries which tasted fabulous.  I'll never frequent this location again, for sure.

My experiences here have not been good! I went in last week, and found a huge change. The hostess was kind and informative. Our server Jessie, was AMAZING! We loved that she was conservative in a room full of hookers! Lol i had to ask if fridays was leaning towards 'sex sells' as every girl there had a butt cheek hanging out. We are picky eaters, and have lots of allergen questions. The restaurant was busy and she took her time explaining things we wanted to know. She was efficient, got things before we asked, and checked on us regularly without pestering us. She was friendly, funny, and all around an amazing waitress.  The food was as good as ever, however, was very slow!! The kitchen messed up my sons order and it had to be sent back. Jessie and her manager (pablo I think) were very apologetic and fixed our order right away! The long islands were amazing as always! Thanks Fridays for turning my opinion around!!! Keep up the good work!

Ive been to Fridays many many times. I just felt that this server was worth the review. Its almost always the same story with them, kitchen working a little slow but it gives  you more times for drinks. Sean my server was great, kept the mood up and kept us interested and refreshed, so refreshed my girl had to drive me home but refreshed never the less. The food was still good and although i know you can get faster service other places on a saturday night having someone making to mood good and keeping it fun is more important to me. Kudos to him and ill definetly be back.

I went to TGI Friday's last friday with my boyfriend.  I had read a lot of bad reviews, but I had a coupon and I don't like to fully rely on reviews anyway.  Overall the experience was decent.  I wanted to rate it at 3.5 stars, but as my choices are 3 or 4 I had to stay at 3.  Contrary to a lot of the reviews on here I had great service.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  The one time that she was busy and I needed something another server spotted me looking around and got me everything I needed.   The food is where the experience fell short for me.  Let me start with the good.  The pretzel sticks and beer cheese were really tasty.  I'd almost go back just for that.   The spinach dip was also pretty good.  I got the vanilla and caramel cake and it was decent; although the cake was a bit dry.  The potato skins were very bland and I did not enjoy them at all.  I got an ultimate margarita, but it was nothing special; not nearly as good as the margaritas at other places (such as Chili's).  Lastly, we got the mini cheeseburger sliders and they were HORRIBLE.  I wouldn't eat them again if they were free and probably not if someone paid me either.  They were reeally salty and seemed like the stuff you get in the freezer aisle.  I hate to reference Chili's again, but I've had their cheeseburger sliders and they were 100x better. At the end of they day I'd much rather just go to Chili's or Applebees because it is the same kind of food and drinks but much better.

Food was good but the service was horrible.  We had a waitress who literally took twenty minutes to bring me a glass of water, someone else brought it by and she returned twenty minutes later,  we were about to walk out.  She never checked on us during our meal and the table next to us was also upset at her  service.  If you go in, skip on the short female waitress.
Food is typical for this venue; however, both times I've been here the service was slow and poor. The facilities could be cleaner too. Its only a place to go if you don't want to go elsewhere.

Ideally, I love TGIF's.  I really can't complain. The services are great. The food is great. The atmosphere is great (if you like loud, family places). It's so chill, you could take the family, or take your first date. It's not too pricey, but not cheap too.

This place is horrid. Not only is their service unnaturally slow and horrid, but their food is clearly out of a bag and straight out of the microwave. The only thing this place has going for them is their drinks and adult shakes.

Awful experience I went with my wife to enjoy our Friday night at Fridays. Needless to say service was very slow. spinach dip was cold chips were cold. Dip taste like it was out of a microwaveable plastic bag. Our server was Jessica she was helpful when you track her down. we really believe she was overwhelmed or just interested in other parties.. I don't know if it's only Fridays but I never ordered something and the server never bring any item out to our table. We had the flat iron stake and a chipotle chicken salad, the chicken was gross and cole slaw taste like pico de gallo.  The bathroom smells really bad on the other side of the room..... The manager never introduced himself as a manager.  the server could not get our order correct when it was time to check out. Needless to say not a pleasant experience.

First of all we we're kind of conned into going to this place by the "buy one get one free" coupons we got from the place we were staying. From the moment we walked in we found out why. This place looked like it was last remodeled in 1992 when the place first opened. It looked very outdated.  Our server only came around periodically and on several occasions we had to flag her down to get some service and this was before the dinner crowd showed up. For being a night of Monday Night Football, the crowd did not seem any larger than a typical week night crowd, yet the staff seemed unprepared. The only reason I'm giving this 1 star was the food was at least decent. We've been to several TGI Fridays before and have enjoyed the food and service but this one is clearly below the mark. You don't have to be an expert restaurant critic to know this place just isn't up to par!

The food is typical Friday's food- and that's what earned them one star.  It's decent food.  I've never had bad food at any location but the service is atrocious here. We arrived at 5pm (before the dinner rush started- by 5:30, there was a waiting list) and we sat and waited and waited for out server, Tyler, to greet us.  We even asked the hostess about 10 minutes into our wait if our server knew we were there.  She said he did.  We must've sat for a good 15 minutes until he came over.  Once he came over, we ordered our drinks and meal in one fell swoop. Minutes later, our son's dinner came out (as we requested) and then our meals came out not too long after. This is when Tyler just vanished into thin air.  We were never offered refills (we had to flag another server down), the same server brought us our check (after we flagged him down again). We saw other servers hustling and bustling, but Tyler was just taking his sweet ol' time.   Wish I would've read the reviews before coming here.  Lack of service tends to be a theme here.
What can I say about TGIF.  It's ok... food is decent and price is decent.  Not too bad but not too good.

I hate to do this review, but it needs to be done. I had made reservations for 12 for my husbands surprise b-day party.  Everyone got there before my husband and I.  I checked in and told them I had reservations for a surprise party (which I told them on the phone) the host pointed me to the back and said everyone is back there.  I had to whisper to her and ask her if she can seat us because my husband doesn't know.  So she did. I knew this was the beginning of a horrible night with bad service, and I was right.  Food was forgotten and never brought out, drinks were not filled.  My nephew is 3 and he never got his food,.  We asked for it and it finally came out while we were eating desert... after we had canceled the order with the waitress.  The server didn't know it was my husband's birthday so I had to ask them to sing happy birthday to him.  All of this was discussed when I made reservations.   We had the bill split up from the beginning and when we got the bill there were items that were on the wrong ticket.  I then gave the waitress my rewards number so I can get the points put onto my card.  I checked my rewards a few days later and the points were never added.  At the end of our visit I complained to the manager.  He was very apologetic and said the waitress is in college.  I'm a mother, I work full time and I go to school.  This is not an excuse to give horrible customer service at work.  I didn't buy that excuse.  So the manager gave us a discount.. which I already had a coupon for a discount, and gave me some coupons to come back. I called a few days later after I noticed I didn't get my rewards.  I got the run around and the manager Paublo never called me back.  I gave up.  T.G.I Fridays has lost my business.   My husbands birthday was a disaster and he did not have as great of a time as he would have liked with his family there.  I was so embarrassed in front of his family since I am the one that planned this surprise party. I am disappointed with our experience there.  I feel I should have been called back right away and given my rewards. I eventually got over it since I never want to go back again.

Please don't come here waste your time and money. Number one their food is microwaved. Number two their serves are slow. Number three the serves can't do the math, they would give you a wrong bill to pay. Please don't go!

So I came on here as a big group, around 14 people. It was sunday at 4 PM and my party was seated fairly quickly as we had a reservation, My server was Lilly. Now look i know that gratuity is included in a large group so you already make money but most people add tips on top of that if the service is good. Which it was not. LIlly constantly disappeared and was very inattentive and slow to do refills or anything, even bringing the check. The service here is horrid and it just angered me. I asked her for a refill for my strawberry lemonaide(which btw they charge for refills) and it took her 15 minutes to bring it to me. WTF?!?!?! At the end of the meal she forgot to add gratuity and i FORGOT TO TIP HER. And as far as the food is concerned, it was average at best. Worse than Chilis or Applebees.

I absolutely HATE giving any TGIF's such a mediocre (at best) rating, but our experience here deserves nothing more. I adore the TGIF franchise; having been a patron ever since I can remember, my family and I have enjoyed consistently great service at every one we've encountered. This location is a sad exception. The FK and I did come in a bit early, I must say, but apparently SO early that we could not be seated at a barside table. Fair enough. We understood and decided to sit at the bar itself. When our bartender/server was around, she was very friendly and okay on efficiency -- but I did notice a lot of extracurricular socializing with other employees. Now, I get it, I used to work in the biz and I know that opening can be a total downer. But when it comes at the expense of serving customers -- it's a huge no-no. Both the FK and I had to wait at different times to request different things, which made it even MORE awkward because we essentially were the only people in here. To make matters even worse, we saw other patrons seated at the barside tables shortly after our arrival. There wasn't even any attempt by that vapid cute little hostess to address us after the fact. Ugh. I hate that. To sum it up for you all: even a decently priced all-day happy hour (on Sundays) is not worth the grief coming in here. The entire place is suffering from complacency, riding the coattails of being a TGIF and also receiving automatic clientele from an attached hotel. The whole experience is just awkward and meh.

Well this makes two bad experiences at a TGIF. I came here with a group of girls after BJ's was too crowded....quickly a bubbly woman from the bar came to take care of us. After she went to get us waters to start a man came over and we said we've already been helped. he awkwardly said this is my section i will go see whats up. well the woman gave us away to him and everything went downhill. The service was awful. He was awkward the entire time.This was a Saturday night but the place was not busy so that could not be their excuse for slow service.  we had appetizers of queso and spinach dip we ran out of chips and we had to ask twice before more were brought out for us and by the time they were brought out our dips were cold. They messed up my sisters drink order and took several minutes to bring out the right drink. the food finally came out and it was just MEH. Thank god we didn't have enough in our group for gratuity because the waiter didn't deserve it. I hope to not return.

I've only been here a couple times and can't recall too many details but recently my husband and I met some friends for late night happy hour around 11:30 pm and had a great server (Luis). The drink specials were affordable. The food was tasty - especially the Jack Daniel's boneless wings - ummm I'll just have a massive plate of those, please. Not sure about the daytime service; from what I read on Yelp it doesn't seem too hot so maybe late night is the best time to go :)

This is, hands down, the best TGI Fridays out of the many I have been to across the country. Granted living in Mission Valley, it's not a crazy drive up to Carlsbad, it is out of the way. There's a TGIF literally 5 minutes from our house, but, I firmly believe, they are the 'special' location. They suck beyond sucking...if you want to pay to be disrespected as a paying customer, go there. Anyways, back to the Carlsbad location, we go up there any time we want some good food and EXCELLENT service. And you should too!

I'm not a fan of TGI Fridays, but my boyfriend and I headed to the bar for drinks on our stay in Carlsbad, as it was conveniently located in our hotel. It was slow on a early Sunday evening. We were happy to find out the happy hour lasts all day on Sundays. Score! We each had a mixed drink and shared an order of potato skins. Our bartender was nice, attentive and made super strong drinks. The appetizer was okay. For the price, it was a good deal.  .

Its no wonder why my wife and I stopped coming here. Every instance is a disappointment. It doesn't matter if it's busy or not and as I draft this, it is not that busy at all. We sat down at 7:20, ordered our drinks and they came at 7:45. We ordered our food at that time and it finally arrived at 8:30. We ordered steak and ribs. The ribs were tough and dry and barely had any meat on them. Possibly cooked off? Her steak was fine as she ordered it well done, but I'm willing to bet that's how all steaks are cooked here because I ordered mine medium rare and it also arrived well done. They were both lukewarm as well. Our server never came by to ask us how our food was, but if he did, I would have sent the steak back and asked them to keep it. I'm not waiting 45 minutes for another one and who knows what they'll do to it.  I can only assume, but I believe this place is under bad management. Its too bad because we thoroughly enjoyed other Fridays locations in the past.  Contact me if this place ever gets better. The menu has so much potential, but the delivery is severely flawed.

This restaurant was Fun! I had a good time tonight after a long day. Food was awesome and killer deal on hard lemonaid from the bar. I had good service everyone made sure I was Taken care of. Busser Steven had a Nice smile and personality! I Deffinatly will come back again.

Overall a good experience. We went there on a busy Friday and were seated as soon as a table opened, we ordered and our drinks took a good while to make their way to our table.  Appetizers were a little faster and they were absolutely awesome, those potato skins rock. I ordered chicken and guess what I got? Salmon... I gave it the first bite and asked for the server to change it, it took a while to finally get my chicken but it's understandable due to the mix up (that didn't have to happen in the first place) Food is awesome, the star less goes to the service, it is a little bit slow... but asides from that it was a great experience and will be coming back.

My husband works close by,  and I will meet him here from time to time. It has always been HORRIBLE as far as service goes. Food, ok, if the server can get your order right. But if feels like the staff is constantly socializing and annoyed at the guests. Not very attentive, and there is one server here we had a few times that makes us so incredibly uncomfortable. A very shakey, nervous person, it is almost unbearable. And the one time we asked to see a manager to complain about our apetizers that took 50 to come out, she herself took 20 min to come out, and just wanted to shut us up with discounts and gift cards. Normally very nice gesture, but I'm the kinda gal where 3 strikes u are out. Going to try to convince my husband to go somewhere else from now on.

Absolute worst experience! Last Saturday I go for a bike ride and afterwards I was feeling a bit hungry so made plans and girl and I head out to TGI Fridays. Have been to the place once or twice before (that location) but not had food as I was meeting friends for drinks before. Upon arriving we get greeted and give them our name for seating. As usual I prefer seating in a booth so we wait for our booth and once they are ready we walk through the bar to go grab our booth. We get dragged to the last booth right before getting to the kitchen and we are asked if that's fine; having  just passed a booth that wasn't as close to the kitchen we choose that one and step back to it and sit. We get seated and menus on the table. A couple of minutes go by and the server comes and takes our drink order, asks if we are ready for our food order, we weren't, and goes and gets our drinks. Could notice this server was in training but no big deal, you expect the same service anyway. We get our drinks and we order our food, they have a 2 for $20 deal so we order though that: - Cheeseburger (medium rare) with sweet potato fries, no onions (upcharge of $1.79 for sweet potatoes without being told about it) - Chicken pasta - Spinach Florentine Flatbread Server advises us we get another appetizer through this promo so we order the second appetizer, Mozzarella sticks. After we order we wait for our food now. I had ordered a diet coke with no ice, and I received my diet coke with ice...no surprise there. The beverage was also not sufficiently carbonated which I assume it's a matter of bad/old equipment. The restaurant is in an old building so it makes sense. After a few minutes I see the server come by and notices there's nothing on the table yet, does not say anything just walks back. Forgot to put the order in? Yup! We get the appetizers in two rounds, first the mozzarella sticks and later the flatbread. I assume we got the mozzarella sticks first as they take less time to prepare. A few minutes later we receive the flatbread which in my taste didn't cook properly, it was not crispy as expected, but the taste was ok. Entree time and our food arrives, a smallish burger that came frozen no doubt and the pasta with chicken that was actually tasty. The burger sat in the food warmers for a while, the lettuce was starting to cook (black color) and was warm to the touch. The burger was cooked well and the fries were a pittance! I did not complain at all as I imagined it was ordered as part of a "value menu" as well as not knowing about the upcharge on the fries. Everything went well, during dinner, food was not worth writing home about but it was within expectations. Nothing to report during dinner other than my cup of diet coke kept getting more ice with every refill. But then came the check... The check came to be much higher than I expected to begin with and that's when I started getting annoyed... Take 1: Call the server (trainer) who gave us the check and told him about the mistake, every entree and appetizer was put on as a "regular" not as a "Promo." He promptly takes the check and comes back about 10 minutes later with the revised check. Take 2: The revised check comes but charges for the second appetizer...I call the server (trainer) again and he explains that only one appetizer is included. I replied that only one appetizer was ordered until we were told that another appetizer was included. Goes back and another 10 minutes go by for the revised check. Finally get the last check with a comped appetizer (regardless at $7.99 for the mozzarella sticks, it's highway robbery!) and I square it off! Got to thinking after I left the restaurant that there were no potatoes in my plate but...too late. The server was in training but that should not have made a difference. At that point we check the yelp reviews and...no wonder! In short: Value in food was bad. Quality of service was bad, ambiance was also mediocre (kept hearing the kitchen all night). Will I go to that restaurant ever again...maybe if it is the last place that hasn't been raided after an apocalypse!
Augh.  Gross.  The floor under our table was wet with god knows what.  The food tasted pre-made, the cocktails were all sickly sweet.  Blehn.
Pretty good service except some of the server girls are a little under dressed. Food was alright.

OH MY was this place TERRIBLE!!!  I've been here a few times trying to give them the benefit of the doubt that it was "x, y, or z" that made it terrible. I give up...they're just terrible.  So this last trip there was 6 in our party, it was a Saturday night at 10pm and the place was all but dead. 1. The waitress spilled water all over me and didn't apologize or offer to get me a napkin--she did however clean up the table.  2. They were out of not 1, not 2 but 3 things that I tried to order 3. The drink I wanted to order had to be purchased WITH a souvenir glass. I didn't want the glass--just the drink. Apparently they can't do that.  4. It took more than 1 hour to get our food after ordering it...REALLY?!? ...for 6 people at 10pm when the place had 3 other people in it? 5. 4 of their staff were outside on patio smoking almost the entire time we were there...no wonder our food took so long--no one works there.  6. They served everyone their dinner except one person because "it wasn't ready yet"....who serves a meal to guests separately? Ramsey would be pissed! By the time we were done eating, the last meal came out of the kitchen.  7. The waitress kept forgetting our orders and had to ask multiple times what we ordered.  8. I'm pretty sure the waitress was stoned...I'm not against that IF she could do her job while stoned because in that event its none of my business...but DANG lady you spilled water on me, forgot our orders, forgot that there was food to be served an hour later, and then forgot to bring us our check after we asked for it twice. Lay off the refer!  Overall it was pretty unbelievable.  I guess the food was so-so ...pretty typical for a chain so thats the 1 star...otherwise they'd have zero.

The food was aweful and the service was worse! We're pretty laid back diners but this review was warranted. It took FOREVER to get our drinks, food and get out and the tab was high. We're out-of-towners so we definitely will not go back but I hope this helps potential customers make an informed decision.

The employees were very pleasant but the food was awful. I've been to many a TGI Fridays so I was pretty surprised. Came here last Friday and we got some garlic shrimp dish and a salmon/steak dish. The garlic dish was AWFUL. It was super greasy and was 90% cheese. Oh and we also found 2 or 3 whole cloves of garlic. It takes minimal effort to chop up a piece of garlic. The salmon/steak dish was waaaayyyy overcooked. Unless every restaurant is closed down in Carlsbad...I doubt I'll go back.
It's a Friday's, no different than any other. It's not where I go for a gourmet meal or specialty drinks, but that Jack Daniel's sampler ALWAYS hits the spot!

I've never had TGI Friday before, that is until last week. The employees were nice, but the service was slow. The table next to us got their appetizer before us and we came 10 minutes before them! The food wasn't all that satisfying either, my stomach still felt empty! The only good thing is, they have good steak.

Now I love TGI Fridays all around. I have been to many and never really had a problem. This place has a problem. So we get there and there's a wait (no biggie) then we get seated. We wait...then get our drink order in....wait ten more minutes...then we get our order in. By now the restaurant is semi empty and we have been waiting 30 minutes for our food. We get the food. My friend ordered her pkate with fries not mashed potatoes and what do you know...mashed potatoes. And my plate looks awesome but the top layer is cold and the cheese has formed a hard layer. My other friend ordered just a slice of red velvet cake which wasn't brought to her until the foodrunner asked if she ordered anything...wtf? So she then gets her cake which is awful. I love TGI's red velvet cake and this tastes like when I decide to bake a cake. It was crumbly and hard with almost no taste. And then we realize we have no utensils! And our waiter is still no where to be seen! We flag down another waitress and she hands us our silverware. We continue to eat in disappointed silence and pay the bill after finishing our food and waiting ten minutes for our waiter to give us the check. Bad experience, will never go back and they need to work on their customer service.

It's TGI Friday's Yelpers what do you want me to say here... On my last visit (for a few beers w/co-workers) included TGI's warm pretzel breadsticks with cheese beer dip.  When the heck did these ninja sticks get added to the menu?  It's like a all the goodness of a warm hot pretzel in convenient "bread stick form" covered in butter garlic salt crack? It came with a cheese dip but I'm a traditionalist "just butter garlic salt crack" for me PLEASE...PLEASE I NEED MORE!!!! You need a break from potato skins?  Actually...those are really hella good too - anyway get these AMAZING pretzels as well!   I give this much needed happy hour 7 "I'll just have ONE plus several more" out of 10.

I have to admit, before these last 4-5 months, I would not opt to eat here as the food and service were always lacking quite a bit in years past. But since they have been advertising with coupon specials for "Buy 1 entree, get 1 free" my grandma convinced me to give it another go a few months ago. Since then, we have been going here almost every Sunday for dinner. The service can be better (hence the 4 stars rather than 5), but the food is DELICIOUS! And ultimately, this is what matters to me most when going out and buying my entrees rather than staying in and cooking myself. The food is much much better than in years past. I recommend giving it another try. Also, the prices are so reasonable! The best dishes I have tried so far:  -Pretzel Sticks (app) -Fried Green Beans w/wasabi dip(app) -Sizzling Chicken & Shrimp plate with Parmesan Steak Fries -Jack Daniel's Chicken and Shrimp -Jack Daniel's Ribs -Chicken Florentine Pasta

I ate here last month with my family for a birthday, and let me say that the food was good, but the staff was great. Everyone was very friendly and kind, and helped a lot. The food was just like what you would expect at any regular restaurant, but the staff made it stand out. I would definitely recommend it.

I read some reviews that don't compliment the food, but I actually really loved the food here. The ambiance was cozy , the staff was friendly and the food tasted really good! The portions were rather large so it's a good value for the price. The overall experience was satisfying and I would definitely go there again. The highlight was getting a flower on our way out in appreciation- so sweet!

Food is not that great here and service is TERRIBLE!! Waitress does not smile or greet you at all, they all look like they hate working there!!! Not once did anyone come ask how the food was or anything.  Never coming here again!

My hubby and I went there on Saturday @9pm. Food was good. Service not so good. We waited about 10 min before anyone asked us for our drink order nor did we get asked if we wanted refills. Music playing was bad. No alternating or a variety of music it sounded like heavy metal. The greeters were young teenagers.  They were not professional. Checking cell phone frequently.  Playing patty cake games, jumping to touch the top of door. Just childish. Definitely do not recommended to others and we will not go back here.

Bad customer service! I came here after work with a large group on a Friday afternoon. It took about 10 minutes to get our drinks. I ordered some appetizers. It tasted good. After we were done with our first round of drinks, our waiter was not sight to take more orders. One of us had to find our waiter. Ridiculous! The waiter suppose to be waiting on us. Moments later the manager appears and apologizes to us. After I was done with my second round, I decided to get my check. The other people in my party were not done yet, but this waiter decides to get everybody else's check. Rude! I should have complained to the manager to remove the automatic gratuity.

TGI Friday's in general is not really my first choice for food, but my friends and I were ravenous after a rehearsal. We were a party of six. We were greeted by some very young hosts that were gossiping at the host stand and barely paying attention to the guests. Upon being seated and served, the service was incredibly slow and inattentive, the whole ordeal took over two hours. Being from the service industry I always leave a tip, but I genuinely could not tip because we had such a terrible experience.  Then again, I should have known to not go there. The first time I sat at the bar and our bartender was clearly intoxicated and the manager thought it was hilarious.  It's just terrible. Don't go there. Just drive the extra 3 miles to get somewhere else.

Came here with my friends after work, the server was a bit confused on taking our order, maybe it was her lack of training, and all the food came out at different times and tasted flavorless and dry. Disappointed. Maybe cause its not Friday?

I loved TGI Fridays in OC. I want to love it sooo bad here. My only gripe is that they should really man the tables more and make sure they are clean. I understand that its not so busy here, but that should be more reason to keep things peachy keen! Other than that the food is good and i really like their happy hour deals and yummmerz on the mixed drinks..!

The windmill that sits perched above the I-5 freeway at the Palomar Airport Road exit is one of the iconic symbols of Carlsbad.  It's a landmark that symbolizes the fact the Flower Fields, Premium Outlets and Legoland are nearby as well as the miles of sandy beaches.  Unfortunately, the TGI Friday's that's connected to this windmill is a tourist trap chain restaurant that's full of wife-beater clad families and crying babies.  Honestly I've never seen a restaurant with more whaling babies and birthday celebrations (I heard at least five while we were there) as this one. I've come here a few times since I live in Carlsbad but this last time was the last time.  I knew it was going to be rough when we sat down on a completely wet booth seat.   Clearly they wiped it down but it was soaking wet.  We only had one set of utensils.  I had to steal some from another table. We decided to go balls-to-the-wall and order steak, lobster, ribs, pizza, and a burger for our family of four.  The food (at over $20 each for the steak/lobster/ribs) was over-cooked, bland and tiny.  I could barely scrape any meat from the lobster tail.  The rib-eye I ordered was puny and tasteless.  I could get a one-pounder at Stater Bros. for $4.99 and cook it myself in half the time it took for the food to come out.  I don't get it.   The drinks were over $8 each and lacked much alcohol.  I would have even taken  the rubbing alcohol version we've heard about in the news if given the choice but no such luck. The bright spot was our waiter.  I can't remember his name (he was a young african-american guy) but he was very nice, had a great attitude and was very attentive.  It's a shame he has to work in this dump. He should move next door to BJ's.  We tipped him well despite the food.

T.G.It's..... OVER! When in Rome (or a tourist trap)...... but there should be a YELP 'zero' rating? Perhaps the WORST Fridays we've ever been to. We chose it because everything else was so busy. Now I know why this place was not. Once finally seated (again it was not busy, they were just painfully slow), we waited an hour for our food (ribs & shrimp, pulled pork sandwich, kids spaghetti and pizza) all of which arrived completely over cooked-- inedible. Perhaps they were cooking it for an hour? There isn't enough beer in the world to make that taste good. Manager comp'd the adults' dinners, which was very nice, but I had to be honest: "thank you, but we will NEVER come back." After putting the kids to bed, I had to make myself dinner.

We have been coming here for over a year and have nothing but great service and food every time that we visit. We went here last night for my son's birthday and they were so nice and made him feel special (he turned 7).....even had one of the servers come by surprise my son with a couple dollars that was folded to look like a shirt. We have always had great food and great service! No complaints!

Typical TGIF food, quiet location with great service.  We did the $2 for $10.  The Spinach Florentine Flatbread appetizer was nice, just enough toppings and the crust was crunchy (but not burnt).  We upgraded to the Flat Iron steaks which were cooked perfectly and tasted great.  Baked potato and broccoli were OK.  Our waitress was very nice.

When we checked in, they told us it would be a 20 min wait, but the restraunt was empty.  I hear a lady complain to the manager, who told her that he thought it wa better for her to wait out front then at a table. They argued for a bit and she finally left. Then the manager made a big deal about it to the other waiting customers.  The waiter took our order and brought out our food at different times. Like 15 minutes apart. The kids order was the last meal to hit the table.  I won't be back.

After spending the day at Legoland, we wanted find a nearby and family friendly place to eat.  A friend suggested T.G.I. Fridays, since they already had McDonald's for breakfast and In N Out for lunch which also are nearby this location.  We were seated quickly since the restaurant was mainly empty.  They did have wide benches that seated our group of 4 adults and 4 children well.  We made our selection of food items and made a few changes to the order.  The waiter was quick to say that he got it when I asked him to review.  When the food came, two of the children's meals had the side dishes swapped and a salad was not delivered.  Half the beverages came at the beginning and the other half during the middle of the meal.  The number of cutlery sets was short, but was finally brought after the food was half finished.  The food was pretty standard.  However, I feel the service was lacking.  Any service adjustment had to be prodded out of the waiter.  The missing salad was brought out and not charged, but they charged for fixing the side dishes.  I ask to them to reverse the charge which they did.  The gratuity was included automatically which we paid.  The children had a great time at Legoland and we will go again, but we won't be stopping here again.

Try -500 stars! Rude, inconsiderate  and just plain crappy! Went here about 2 weeks ago great service. Today they were so bad we walked out!  If you want horrible service this is your place! Now you know why the place is EMPTY when you go here. Thanks for giving me pnemonia !

I wish I could give less than 1 star.   We went with my in-laws who for their last night in town dinner.  6 of us total.  (our children)  This is not a restaurant we normally go to and this was MY 1st time there.   My mother in-law ordered wine...took 15 minutes for them to tell us they were out...she ordered a different glass and that took 15 minutes to get to our table...that was JUST the beginning.  We all ordered something different.  1 item from the children's menu...I'll start with that.  My son actually asked "how big is the burger?"  He was VERY hungry and would have ordered off the adult menu if the waitress didn't assure him that the childrens cheese burgers were "HUGE" and it would fill him up.  He is small for his size and age (11) but I told her he has a larger appetite than he looks.  Again, she assured us the burger would be enough.  It wasn't even close.  It was plain and she rolled her eyes when he asked for ketchup...ayfkm?  He cleaned his plate and ate most of my veggies...and we will wrap back to those in a moment.   My husband ordered a Reuben sandwich...now there are 3 - arguably 5- things that make a Reuben a Reuben.  Corned beef, thousand island and sauerkraut -rye bread and provolone cheese..but whatever.  His came out with zero sauerkraut....but a TON of grilled onions.  Not that big of a deal...but he WANTED the kraut.  So he asked for some on the side.  10 freaking minuets later they let us know that they were completely OUT.  He was pissed.  So he sent it back.  The manager came over and said the kitchen was upset that he didn't like it but that he had started to eat it.  (he took 2 bites)..how many freaking people inspect to make sure their order is correct?  Yeah, that is dumb.   At this point the rest of the food had finally come out...yeah, it came out one plate at a time.   He ordered an app and said he wasn't happy with the Reuben and wouldn't be paying for it.   My father in law's pasta was cold...and not just sitting on the side waiting to come out cold...like freaking frozen in the middle COLD.  My mother in laws steak was over cooked so she sent it back...they cooked it through...she just ate it.  My older sons ribs were UNDER cooked and we sent those back.  I am just going to skip my salmon...but you get the idea.   The manager convinced us to order cheesecake.  I asked how big they were...here we go again...I'd prefer for the children to share.  But she insisted the slices were tiny...so they both got their own...they are HUGE.  ha of course.  I did have a bite as well as my husband and the cheesecake was very good...the only thing that was.     NOW for the check...they had the wine they were out of on there...claiming I had a glass.  HAHAHHA no - I didn't...I had water, not wine.  The Reuben was on there as well as the app and cheese cake...nothing was comped.  All the problems we had and sending so much back and they didn't even comp us the cheesecake the manager said we would.....My husband now was LIVID...and still hungry.  The manager came over and took the check.  We had to negotiate the damned check.  wine (that they were OUT OF !!!) should come off, Reuben OFF, and at least 1 cheesecake.  She wasn't happy but she ended taking all that off and my husbands app.  Well, thanks.  At this point that little gesture is meaningless.   We couldn't get home soon enough...guess what now...that app, the only thing my husband actually ate...came right back up.  We had to pull over 3 times for him to vomit.  Awesome.   Stay away from this place...

Just horrible! When I asked if the bar ran out of margarita glass, the bartender responded with 'the glass is on the otherside of the bar so I used what I have left's food came out and everything was cold. There was only a few tables @ the bar and our server never stopped by to ask if we needed anything. We will never come back to this location.

Today we went with friends and I ordered for my mom and I.   We ordered a Turkey Burger and a balsamic glazed chicken Ceser salad.   The salad had a very little drizzle of balsamic glaze on the very dry chicken which was laid on top of a very dry salad.  It sucked.  The Turkey Burger was apparently out of box from the freezer because that is what it tasted like.  All the burgers ( i found out) come dry with nothing on them which is fine but then dont drop off the friggen burger without asking me what I might want you to bring to put on it.  I dont want to wait till you come back around to tell you to bring something.   I told her we were splitting our orders and she offered no extra plates, gave my mom no silverware, etc etc etc..  The waitresses were very nice but they need to know better customer service.   TGIF does not have quality food.   The only thing I can say positive about the experience is my car was parked close to the exit.     In the past I have had cocktails here.  I would suggest keeping it limited to that.

Party of 14 We called and gave them a heads up we were coming on a Saturday night. They had our table ready and our waiter was immediately present once we all sat down. Service, food, and staff were great! No complaints here!!! Will come back again when we are in town. Kudos to a job well done!

I should give this place no star . Usually dont like doing the whole chain resturaunt but me and my friends were starving and this was the closest thing . Walked in on a saturday night and it was empty which shoulda been a dead give away to us but still listening to our stomachs instead. Sat down ordered and i swear every two minutes was a birthday song . The booth smelled like a bathroom . When we got our food i was disappointed the noodles werent all the way cooked and looked like it came out of a can . They gave us dirty napkins . Paid 14 bucks for the chicken parm and presentation was gross and for the price we got little to nothing . Wont be going back not even as a last resort

Service is always a little slow, but it's because they are usually pretty busy and only have one or two servers on for the entire bar. The drinks and food are worth the wait. Can't go wrong with their happy hour drinks and 1/2 off all apps!! Whenever I go I sit with Luis in the bar because he always takes great care of me and my friends. Carlos is a great bartender and always super friendly too! They are open till 2am so it's definitely convenient for us in the food industry. I am a regular here and love it!

Worst customer service ever. Hostess said to sit anywhere in the bar then came to let us know that only the barstools are available . All other booths and tables are reservation only.  It was gonna be a 20 minute wait. There were 2 booths available and 3 tables.. Really? Way to go! Guess you do not want return customers or any customers for that matter. Guess your wait staff is ill equipped to handle more than 2 tables in his or her section at a time!!! Will never go back nor refer any of my customers to your place of business.
Omg!!! No hamburgers?  They've been out for a month!!! No avocado!!! Who's running this place, it's a joke... They just roll their eyes and say oh well.

This place is really terrible.  It seems that servers are really unhappy.  We stayed at the Carlsbad on the Sea resort, so this was the restaurant to dine at for the hotel guests.  We went there for dinner right after we got checked into the hotel after a plane ride and a drive from the airport.  We got seated by the bathrooms and had to wait for 20 minutes for even a glass of water.  In the meantime, I saw one waitress arguing in front of guests with the hostess that she didn't want any guests seated in her section because she was already too busy.  how unprofessional!  I get it that she may have been overworked but it smacked of airing the dirty laundry in public.  It could have been done out of the earshot of the diners. The place is also very dingy and dirty. With all the dining choices in the area, we left and never returned.
Food is so so.  service barely OK.  Decent happy hour prices.  Outside of happy hour, wouldn't do it.
Service was a bit slow but that wasn't the real issue. The utensils were dirty, the steak knife had some snot looking stuff on it. I used my hands while there...

This TGI Fridays location has gone completely down hill. They were out of a majority of the items we attempted to order on the menu..bartender ignored us the entire night. Will not be back until it returns to the great restaurant it used to be....

My family and I came here on Saturday night while in town for vacation. We understood there would be a wait, and were quoted at a 20-25 minutes for a table (party of 8). After waiting about 40 minutes, we checked in with the hostess and were told it would be another 15-20 minutes. They told us that the kitchen was backed up, and even if they sat us in 20 minutes though, we wouldn't get our food for at least another hour. ARE YOU F-ING KIDDING?? 2 hours for food after being told 20-25??? We were swindled and robbed of our time. We had 6 hungry adults and 2 starving children.  It was a terrible mess, and a complete waste. Needless to say, we told them to forget it and we went down the street to eat at In-n-Out. Had we known service would be so terrible at TGI Friday's, we never would have stepped foot inside. Not recommended, will never be back.

Going to this place is like taking a stroll in the twilight zone! All of the people working here have the strangest attitudes and looks on their faces. Not friendly at all! The only word that would sum up this entire experience is BIZARRE! To top it all off, the food was terrible as well!

Its been a while since ive been backt o this place and that was when I was not 21 lol. Now that I am...this place is definitely my favorite only because of their killer happy hour!!  I sat at the bar and I was immediately greeted and had my beer in hand all in 5 minuets. It wasnt busy at all which was great but the people that were here that day was a pretty quiet crowd. Generally when you sit at the bar you expect to have some small conversations with some cool/weird people...who knows! Maybe youll find your next gf here haha. Well when I was there I was being stared at from across the bar by some weird couple, I kept checking my face to see if it was really that ugly but that wasnt the case. So I stared back at them (stare contest began) and I held my ground until my eyes dried out then I looked down at my empty beer lol.  I like the fact that they have two options of cup size, one is 16 and the other is 22oz. I would recommend you take advantage of the 22oz deal since the cost for it is only 2-$3 more!! I cant say much but the fact that the people that do go here is families and older people (50+) but I will update my review next time I come back, but for now 3 stars because it didnt really wow me in any way and plus I was at the bar so I pretty much serviced myself.
Terrible service. The kids were done with their dinner before I got mine and it was just a burger. All of our food was under cooked and not to our liking. Never coming back here.

My wife and i came by this place because ita "friday fun night" and what better fun than going to a restaurant?! And with fridays, you cant fail! So far, we are having great service with the waitress being very atentive and making sure we have enough to drink. I got a long island and decuded to not get a second, but she did offer! I got my clam chowder that made my wife jealous she didnt order one when the smell hit her nose. I ordered the philly stacker or something like that with some homemade chips.  and my wife got a steak, baked potato and broccoli.  The burger eas sooo awesomey! It has the taste of the philly cheesesteak with the nice and comfy burger. And the chips were a lot beter and not as hard as most house chips. Blessing to my fresh dental work!  And my wife's steak was according to her..no comment! Lol! She still enjoying and seeing from her smile, its great!  The server was prompt with our bill too! Always a good thing when you are in a hurry!

Sometimes, you just want to go some where chill, have a beer and watch the game.  Fridays is a good spot. Great happy hour specials for food and drink after 10 and open until 2am which is rare in north county.   The bartenders rock and I always get good service.    The cajun chicken pasta is amazing, definately my fav.

I am very very disappointed with TGI FRIDAYS. It was my first attempt to every dine with them and of course i was excited to see what food and service they have to offer. I was with a friend that night. and let me tell you it was a WEEKDAY. So we went in and was asked to wait for 20 mins.. we were thinking it was busy so OK we waited just like everyone else. So after 20 mins we have been called to get seated and as we waled into their dining floor i was surprised how SLOW they were for them to have everyone wait AT LEAST 20 MINS. Ok whatever i didnt voice myself out yet. So this lady sat usdown the last booth which smelled gross as fuck.. she handed us the Menus and said that our server will be there in a few minutes. Ok so me and my friend browsed through the menu to see whats good.. we talked and browsed through the menu again. WAITING FOR OUR SEVRER.. next thing you know all we did was browse through the damn menu.. and i timed it and was about 40 min and YET NOBODY NOT A SINGLE DAMN EMPLOYEE OFFERED US A BEVERAGE.. OH WOW! HOW BUSY THEY WERE RIGHT? WE WALKED OUT OF THAT PLACE AND WILL NEVER COME BACK.

Got food poisoning here a few years ago and thought I'd already done the review. Parents and I came in right before close and were ready to go somewhere else when we saw their hours, but they insisted we come in. I got a coke and a turkey sandwich on ciabatta. The bread was waxy, the meat seemed kind of slimy, and I obviously didn't finish the food. Next day I was laid up worse than I've been since my week long flu in the second grade. Couldn't keep anything down for days. Diners beware!

Not only a low quality restaurant, because it is a tgif.... but also long waits because it is on a hotel property. To make matters worse, low quality staff. Sitting and waiting for a table I am watching the GROUP of host&hostesses talk about disrespectful topics regarding the customers. Insulting them when they walk away. What horrible people!!! Hey t.g.i. Fridays,  get new staff!!!! Ugh!!

It was my wife and I first time to a TGIFriday and I wasn't impressed for a Friday night. Literally, there was only 2 other couples in there. So we gave it a shot...I ordered a hamburger with bacon and blue cheese and my wife some dish that had chicken breast.......My hamburger could have been better built at Burger King or McDonald's and my wife returned her plate twice and ended up eating nothing. The manager was generous enough to offer a free meal but my wife refused...No atmosphere, No vibe. This place in CARLSBAD was pretty lame, I just hope other TGIFridays are better.
Had not been here in years since they revised their menu and eliminated their French Onion soup and deep fried mushrooms Came in for happy hour and apps. Everything was great
Boooo. If leaving zero stars was an option this place would not exists. Avoid at all costs.

I ordered the Sizzling Steak with tomatoes and mozzarella. I don't think I have been ripped off this badly in years. It cost $15.00 and was the tiniest meal I have ever seen. A 3 inch diameter of meat was placed on a thin bed of spinach and zucchini. The "side salad" was a few tomatoes and hunks of mozzarella. I laughed when I saw it and am mad that I accepted it. Meal was meh... Servers, however, were very attentive and nice. Oh well...never again.

Worst Friday's ever!!!!!! I came here with my family after a trip to legoland...  1st issuse... when we stood at the door to get seated the hottest and her friend that also worked there where to busy looking at her phone. Then at her convince she then sat us.  2nd issue the server came took our order and I ordered a drink a simple Pomegranate Margarita. .. she brought us 2 glasses of water and my kids lemonade (no plates no forks no paper towels no straws nothing) 20 mins later nothing and then I went searching for my server.  When i found her i asked her about my drink and she said oh everyone order at the same time so that's why it's taking to long ... huh?!? It was only 4 other ppl when we walked in .  Ok fine ...she comes back and then says that oh we don't have pomegranate right now did you want something else. I said no thanks. But why did it take you 20 mins to say something.  She said oh I'm sorry did you want something else I said no.  3rd issuse .. When the food came it was cold and blah...   I order a spinach dip that took at least 30 mins to come and and it came out with the food and it was cold ... I had a loaded baked potato it had about 3 bits of bacon on it but was cover in sour cream. I ask her is this a baked potato she proudly state yes ... hmmmm I told her never mind. Then a manager came over and said sorry it took so long to let you know about the drink. He took off my cold appetizers .... I didn't want anything free I just want my stuff right. I will never be back. And it seems this place needs a whole new staff... home office needs to know that is place is not going to last and hit yoy numbers with whom ever is in charge of this Fridays

Went to this place last night. Horrible service. We had a party of 16. They told us 15 min to be sat. 20 minutes later they told us they are setting up tables. 20 minutes after that they told us 15 more minutes. Didn't get sat for over an hour....they weren't even that busy. Then most of our parties orders were either wrong, over/under cooked and poor quality for the hellacious price they charge. Don't go....not to this one.

Horrible service! Took us a long time to just get some water. Then when they finally brought our beers they didn't have coasters.  Time to order and our waitress took forever, we came in for 10$ appetizer and entree deal they have.  It was strange that they didn't have that on their regular menu, the waitress handed us a scrunched up paper from her pocket. Apparently they don't promote the 10$ deal unless YOU ask FOR IT which I thought was ridiculous.  She didn't even know what were talking about I had to ask her twice. Took us a while to pick our. Food the appetizers came out first mozzarella sticks and potato skins which surprisingly were good and hot.  Couldn't finish them.  For my entree I ordered the cheesey chicken with mashed potatoes, while the boyfriend got the steak,  veggies and mashed potatoes. The service was awful BUT the food was actually good.  I didn't tip the waitress and didn't feel bad because honestly service really lacked.
Service was slow. Could have walked over to the am/pm quicker to my drink.  Paper towel dispensers in the head were broken.

The hubby and I were given a gift card to last weekend we headed down to this TGI since it's the closest location to us. We sat at the bar and order a beer and I tried the grape envy martini. Both we served quick and with a smile. The martini wasn't too strong and perfect in my eyes. We looked over the menu and decided to order from the 2 for $20 promotion they have going on. The crispy green beans are a must and that was included in the appetizer choices. They came up quickly and tasted great as always. I ordered a pasta dish and the hubs orders a shrimp and chicken. Both were fantastic. Over all we had a great experience. I was not a fan of the martini with champagne in it, but that's just my taste.

Terrible! The waitress didn't know the menu. The manager was argumentative the food was cold. I had to go to the dang bar to get my food HOT. The bartender should be working bar not picking up the slack for serving staff that is incompetent. Stay away! Go to BJ's down the street. Muuuuch better.  I have given one star only because I can't give none. Horrible restaurant. And it's a shame that it is too because it's the only Fridays in the area.

We went to TGI Friday's after a trip to Legoland - on the way back to LA.  All we wanted was a quick lunch before we headed out on the road.  There were 8 of us; 4 adults and 4 kids.  Granted, we were a large group, it shouldn't have been unmanageable for a large restaurant chain.  We waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  Once seated, it took another 10 minutes to put in lunch orders for the kids.  Then we waited.  And, waited, and waited and waited...about 45 minutes later 2 of the kids orders came to the table.  Mind you, we didn't order complicated dishes.  The kids had simple pasta and cheese pizza orders.  We put our orders in about 35 minutes of waiting and didn't get our food until an entire hour after being at the restaurant.  Any questions we had for the wait staff were given dismissive responses back.  Poor attitude, poor service and tasteless food.  People who came in much after us were served faster.  They had eaten and left while we were still waiting.  The place is HUGE, what's the point of having an enormous space if you can't serve even a fraction of the capacity?  I would not recommend this place, EVER!  I don't think the management cares.  I feel like it's easier to keep it like this because unsuspecting tourists will always try it once.

My son has been up all night vomiting... Had two bites of clam chowder and said it tasted funny.. We sent it back... Terrible food. Terrible service. Looking at other reviews they should close this place.

went there xpecting more varietys too coose from on all u can eat meals but only ended up with 6. also had wait for 10/15mins or more too arrive each round. however service was great an atmosphere an attractions was great.

First Time coming here and I was so disappointed for the poor service and bad food quality, everything looked so good and what not but it wasn't ,atleast not My husband's , mine was okay . I seriously didn't expect not to like this place .

Horrible service. The food was ok but a 30 minute wait for appetizers and 50 minutes for entrées is unacceptable. My husband requested dipping sauce but it never came, I ordered a drink, it never came. The server was nice but our dining experience was less than pleasant.
the food was okay. but the service sucked. we waited forever for our food and not many people were there. definitely will not be going back

We walked out of this place. Let me say the same as others have posted they should fire all staff and start over.  The hosted was like oh you want a seat we said yes then the bad look like why are you bothering me kind of attitude started.  Nope not again will we set foot in this place

This place is the worst TGIF that we ever been too. I guess they don't care since they get  alot of tourist from Legoland or the Outlet. We went here after Legoland and the wait was horrible the manager sits a large party before sitting when clearly my party was there. It took us 45 minutes with a 1/2 empty restaurant to be seated.  In addition how in the hell do you run out of Jack Daniel's ribs are 630 pm. Once we placed our food order it took another 40 minutes to get cold food. So avoid this place and go to Rubys instead at the outlet.

Not a great experience here. My wife and I ate here and I got the lunch special. It had 9 fries. I asked about it and they said that is how it comes. Yes I could count how many. I would suggest somewhere else for lunch

This.has   the worst friday ever.  The service was horrible...the restrooms were nasty. I never felt so mistreated at a place in a long time. The manager was as bad as her staff...im considering never eating at a Friday's ever again
We went for the endless apps.  The were tired and dry.  The potato skins were cold, the chicken wings tasted better from Costco frozen section.  And our sandwich looked beat up.  We will not be back.

I have been eating at TGIF's all over this great nation of our's and this location is so far from being called a restaurant. First waiting to be seated we saw 4 staff members pass us by 15 mins later the host showed up and took us to our seat. I wonder if it is TGIFs. Practice to have staff members not acknowledge guests coming to eat . Ok second we ordered drinks simple or so you would think.  "2 cokes. Child's chocolate milk and a large milk in a chilled pint glass". I have no idea why this place only has 3 stars?!?! so my 21st birthday was August 2nd 2014 and I took my mom, boyfriend and about 12 of my friends to BJs at midnight so I could get a shot when I turned 21. apparently they have some ridiculous rule that they couldn't serve me right at 12 so I took the whole crew to fridays! amazing choice by the way. This place is the WORST! They don't deserve this one star at all. My family and I stopped here while visiting Legoland for my nieces and daughters birthday. After another 20 mins the hostess came back with a half ass apology and excuse about how busy she was. (reminder... there is about 2 other small groups in there with us). The to-go box came 10 mins later after our hostess gave ours away to the next table, who had just sat down to order lol. This place was ridiculous!! And not worthy of the $15.00 they charged us for gratuity.

I had read all of the reviews talking about the bad service and figured they had to be wrong. No place can be that bad.  Well, I am reporting that they were all wrong! This place is even worse than everybody says!  It started by not even being able to find the restaurant.  It is buried on the side of a hotel and there is no sign outside to indicate the entrance to the restaurant. It is crazy. Once inside, we waiting for about 10 minutes for someone to come over to the check-in desk. The restaurant was almost empty, but the two servers they had were running in circles.  When someone came over they asked if they could take my name. I asked why they needed to take my name when nobody was there and there were tons of open tables. They said "we needed to wait for a table."  It was very strange, but we finally got seated. Once we sat down we waited another 10 minutes to get menus and then another 10 minutes to even get a glass of water.  We went for the "endless appetizers" and one kids meal. It took 45 minutes for the food to come out. When we asked for another round of apps, it took another 30 minutes to get them.  After being there for more than an hour and half, we had received two rounds of appetizers. One of the apps we ordered were the Ahi Tuna Crisps. They put three on the plate and each is the size of a tortilla chip, so we ate these pretty quickly, but we couldn't wait another 30 minutes to get three more crisps.   We has also ordered the potato skins, but these tasted sour so we wanted to send them back.  The waitress said we "weren't allowed to swap out the appetizer." We said that we didn't like it and it was bad. After some back and forth, she allowed us to get something else. The waitress told us that they other server was taking the food that was meant for our table, so she had to put our orders back in. The place was empty!  This made no sense at all. I am not sure how Friday's corporate office can let this location stay open. It is a joke and makes us never want to go to another Fridays.  We were told that they would take one app and the kids meal off the bill. When the bill came we were still charged for the two apps. They said they took off the potato skins that we didn't eat.  I pushed back and they finally adjusted the check. If you are in the area, PLEASE avoid this place. All of the reviews that talked about the bad service were actually being kind. It is worse than you can ever imagine. Save your time and money and go elsewhere.

And when my boyfriend (who does not pay as much attention to these things as I do) goes to order a beer at 9:55pm, how about be cool and say, hey, wait 5 minutes and it'll be on Happy Hour!  Just kind of lame, on top of the not giving us the other menu for the wings...seemed like they were steering us away from the offered deals, to get a higher check total...well that doesn't guarantee a bigger tip.  It actually guarantees an average tip.  Because if you were trying to be helpful and cool and point us in the right direction to save a few bucks, then you'd have gotten a better than average tip.   The food is consistent, they have a full bar, etc.
