Pepper which he didn't get until the middle of our order when the food came out. Were ordered 2 traditional wings which we only got one because the bartender didn't put it in correctly and no apologies. As I told him about that he rolled his eyes. Our pretzels were extremely salty, we had to scrape it all off. Overall it was a complete disaster of a restaurant visit! I didn't want to ask for the manager and make a scene so I felt writing his review would be a better way of complaint. We spent about $30 in the restaurant and I would like a refund being that we are on our honeymoon and won't be back to the Fridays.
I am very disappointed with the specific location.. The food took forever to come out and the chicken was very dry.. I will never come back
Good  service and great food my kids where very happy with our waitress and she was awesome. My kids had not been here before and loved the food

Staying at the Carlsbard By Sea resort,  Fridays is located within the premises thought it be an easy dinner run. When we arrived we were excited to see many tables open. Am traveling with 3 children under 10yrs and they were hungry. We get there and the 2 hostess tell me I have to wait 45 to 50 mins. I ask why and very rudely I get told because they had been busy with a 20 guest party the past 2hr and need to slow down the kitchen down. I understand if there's no table but the whole outside deck and majority of floor is open. The kids don't want to sit on the floor in the waiting area since there isn't enough chairs and everyone else is also waiting with kids. The attitude of the hostesses was the deal breaker. Am used to waiting am from L.A. but a "sorry you have to wait" makes a huge difference when your being told there's a long wait.

four of us decided to dine at TGIF but after see there 2 star rating from 200 reviews and read them that was enough for so we did want to chance it; So we all decided to take "High End B' advise and looked up BJ on yelp found what a difference in rating 3 1/2 over 400 reviews along with over 200 photo's to view.....Bottom Line we made the right choice. BJ's Our server was great. The only neg would be 'No' happy hour on Saturday except late evening . Mon Thru Fr; 3 to 7    For such a popular chain as TGIF 2 star no excuse ether get a new Manager or this location will be closing.

It looks like Friday's management is clueless.  The past few visits have been bad.  All the good bar tenders are gone, the foo and service sub par.  We went for dinner on Memorial Day.  Sat at the bar, took 5 minutes just to get served.  After another 10 minutes we were told it would take 50 minutes for food! The bar had about 8 guests and the restaurant was not even full. We won't be back anytime soon.

From the start the atmosphere was funky. The girls at the front seemed nice, then they told us there was a wait, Which was odd cus the parking lot was empty. They proceeded to seat us in front of the bathroom you could hear the toilets flushing which left nothing for the imagination. I wasn't too pleased with the seating assignment. We met our waiter and he gladly moved us to our preferred location. He was super nice and accommodating.  He too was a little funky, he seemed to be high energized and quick. He was on top of our drinks, orders and our meals came out promptly. He even informed us about their rewards program which got us a free appetizer.  The inside of the restaurant was dark, dingy and out dated. The overall experience was ok. Not good enough for me to visit again tho.

Do yourself a favor and don't come here. Guaranteed this place goes under in the next 12 months. Service was truly awful. Even worse than what I'd expect from a dumpy low-brow watering hole. Both our drinks came out completely wrong and tasted like diabetes in a glass (since when does a Manhattan appear neon yellow?!). Just disgusting on multiple levels.

Brought my family for dinner, they sat us down very quickly and took our orders. The food was good and brought out to us pretty quick. Unfortunately they lack in service. They were staffed well from what I could see but it seems they had couple different servers covering our table so a common thing like checking up on us was forgotten. All I needed was water but was able to requested it when they brought out the bill.

We found out that happy hour was all day Sunday with half off most appetizers as the hook that drew us in.  Our waiter was great, positive personality, really helpful, attentive and overall a pleasure to have at our table - but the food was way below our expectations. The spinach dip tasted like it  was diluted with water, wings were tiny and hard as if they had been in the deep freeze for years. Sliders were a decent size, but size isn't the same as quality. The flat bread topped with pesto and tomatoes was HORRIBLE. I can't believe they let these leave the kitchen. I would've given 1 star, but i had to add another because our server was so great.

Awful service, the tables around us were dirty and never got cleaned in our time there, food was pretty bland but that's just chain restaurants I guess. Our server didn't tell us specials or happy hour info, walked away in the middle of a conversation when we asked about prices- I think he went to look up the answer and then just didn't come back. Don't go here. Go to chili's.
Terrible!!!!  Service?????  Took over 45 min for a salad and soup and hamburger!!! The place was NOT full by any means . I will not be back!!!

After reading reviews for this specific location, my family and I were very skeptical, but decided we were there anyway so we might as well stay and give them a chance. The server we had was new and it showed. Although she was incredibly sweet, she was slow and inattentive. She passed our table several times without asking if everything was ok or even to ask if we needed refills on our drinks. It took over 30 minutes just to get our appetizers and we were there for the unlimited appetizer deal they have going on. When were finishing our last appetizer I found a strawberry in our flatbread bbq pizza which DID NOT include strawberries at all. My sister is highly allergic to strawberries. Nothing we ordered contained strawberries nor should it have been around anything that contained strawberries. We went to the manager immediately and told him what was going on and he proceeded to tell us that we should have informed our server of any food allergies. We didn't think to notify them because after all we ordered wings and pizza, none of which contain strawberries. He then told us that it was our fault. After going back and forth with him for a few minutes he agreed to give us discount. The discount was not our intention at all. After we received our final receipt we noticed that he had only taken off our drinks. A whole $5 worth. He was rude and and completely unapologetic. He told us that it was our fault for not informing our server and that all of the same utensils and knives are used to prepare ALL the dishes. Needless to say we will never be back to this location. Their lack of courtesy and sympathy was felt and definitely made us uncomfortable. The food was great and we realized it was an honest mistake but it's the way the situation was handled that gives us reason to NEVER visit this location again.
Still havnt heard back grom corp management re: there poor seevice and ruining my new purse

Went here for my anniversary because I wanted to try the endless apps. Husband got the fish and chips, it was $11.99 but it was alright. No coleslaw was given, just cod fish and fries with tartar sauce. It was good when it first came out but once it got cold, the fish was no longer good and it tasted like it came from a freezer. I am a appetizer addict and was super excited to try endless apps. It's $12 for all you can eat but the selection is limited. I would prefer to come during happy hour than try endless apps again. The app selection is mozzarella sticks, potstickers, flatbread chicken, loaded baked potato skins and boneless wings and that's it. You can only order one app at a time. Happy hour is a lot better because the selection is more and I believe it's half off. Overall, the potato skins were definitely better than usual and the food was decent for the price. Will probably come back, but during happy hour pricing.

45 mins to get seated (empty tables all over & the hostess blamed that they were training in the kitchen), got our appetizers quick (which tasted horrible), and then took another 45 mins to get our dinner (which was over cooked, slimy and bland. Complained to the manager which she said she was fairly new there and that she's been getting lots of complaints and laughed about it. At least she took $50 off the bill. Clearly the owner needs to clean house here and fire everyone from the wait staff up! We will never visit this establishment again!!

Ate here during happy hour yesterday. We were seated right away, and the place was almost empty. Ashley was our server. I ordered A Dos XX and double shot of Grand Mariner neat. My fiancé ordered a mixed drink which also has GM in it. She brought me my beer and informed me they were out of GM and offered to get me something else. I declined, so she left and came back after she discovered the drink my fiancé ordered could not be made because they were out of GM. So she ordered something else.   I noticed they were offering Cuervo Gold shots for $3ea so I ordered 2 of them. She said she didn't think I could order that because it was happy hour, and should get a well drink instead. I asked what she meant by that.....again she had to go ask. So I asked when I could order the $3 shots. She asked me to show here where I saw that price. I pointed to the huge poster on their wall advertising it. So she went to talk to the bar tender and returned saying the offer is good all day whether or not its happy hour. So I ordered them, and she delivered them with a male with some limes.  She was nice, checked on us often, but not knowledgeable about the bar and promotions.  I had a rib eye steak(I like Filet Migon, but is not on the menu) and it was chewy. The mashed potatoes and seasoned fries were good. Fiance had a chicken dish and she liked it.  All in all, we probably wont be back.

Haven't been here in a few years, and dinner tonight made me remember why. Saw the TV add for $10 all you can eat appetizers. Which we found out you pick one and have to stay with that. Or $12 and you could pick from 5 things and switch off whenever you want. It was me and my girl, so we each got an appetizer, The food they brought us after 15-20 min of waiting was wrong, no problem we were hungry and planning to get one of everything anyways. Second round some random waitress brought us some wrong wings, ended up being for a different table, 20 min later finally got the right food. 3rd round was the correct food also but had to wait another 15-20 min to get it. Out of everything the only thing I thought was good was the cheese sticks. Waitress wasn't the best service I've ever had but she was nice and despite disappearing a few times wasn't too bad.  We went on a Monday night at like 8pm I could understand the wait time if it was the weekend but seriously on a Monday? Won't be going back For the same price I would have been much happier at BJs or Karl Strauss which are a very very short drive from tgi.

Not being from this area, I jumped on yelp to read the reviews. I decided to go because I've never been to tgif. Waited less than 5 minutes to get seated, food was brought out in an appropriate amount of time. The server frequently checked on us. I was there for a total of 40 minutes, I was really pleased I didn't have a horrible experience.

We were told the wait was 30 mins yet half the place was empty?!  Seriously?  There were two hostesses and the manager was standing at the front doing nothing but chatting .   The manager should have helped wait tables if they were short staffed.   But as the other reviews say they obviously need a new manager.....  We went across the street and found Rubys diner.  That place was amazing by the way.

I remember the times while in college,  my friends and I were big fans of TGIF. Alas, their glory days appear to be setting into to a dismal sunset. We went here to try to catch some happy hour after shopping at the outlets.  (FYI - they are the only ones in that little center that have happy hour on Sundays...  3-6pm yo).  We were seated promptly and ordered a couple of drinks and a few HH food items... So...the one star in this review is for our server.  He was a sweetheart and genuinely offered good service, to the best of his ability. The food though,  I have yet to figure out what the heck was up with it.  I ordered a baked potato, which was great with the sour cream and chives. The drinks (Zombies) were good too, and priced well at $7. But the shrimp cocktails...we struggled to finish them!  I've ordered it at TGIF before,  but this time they tasted old and defrosted (kinda rubbery) and the ahi chips were old too... stale chips and fishy tasting ahi (oxymoron, I know).  It was terrible.  My fiancé and I felt sick until the next morning!  Definitely a final nail in the coffin for me and my TGIF days.

The server didn't correctly explain a dish, we had to send back the steak once for being way undercooked and the same steak the second time for being over cooked, and the chicken on the pasta was over cooked and dry.  The only edible meal on the first go round was the kids grilled cheese. Pathetic.  The reviews are right.  We should have listened.  Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.

I should have looked at the reviews! Had to find a worker and ask if we get seated or seat ourselves. It was dead so you think the service would be good. Steak tasted like it had  freezer burn cold fries  ! Will not be back to this place

For the most part my visits here are meh and the place is kinda old and outdated but last our visit our waiter was great. His name is Dana i believe. He was very friendly and made our visit very pleasant. The food is great but the drinks not so much. Overall its an average place.

Initially I was going to give this place one star.   All because of the manager (FW/40 heavy set with red hair in a bun).  She was so rude. We had a party of six and told us the wait would be 25-30 min.  We asked if we could sit at the bar and she said no.  In LA kids can sit at the bar with their parents & I understand that Carlsbad has different rules.  But as I walked away she gave me the dirtiest look.  We walked outside to see if everyone wanted to wait.   I walked back in and told her we would wait.  This was at 7:45pm.  8:15pm another member of our party asked how long it would be and she told him at 8:30.  Before it was 25-30 min now it's exactly at 8:30,, 45 min.  How could they know for the table would be ready exactly at 8:30? I didn't mention how empty the restaurant was or how people after us had been seated before us.  The other member of our party told them we would split our party but of course our table was ready.  When she seated us we saw an elderly couple that had come in after Us was seated in a booth for 8 people.  That's when I knew the manager was being an AH.  Our server was a really nice girl who did a great job with juggling tables and the bar.  The food was ok.  The steak seemed as if they were preheated.   The manager is suppose to be the rock of an organization but instead she was the problem.  Maybe you should invest more into your managers so employees can have a better example.

Our family of 14 (6 children under 7 yrs) enjoyed a great dinner on Saturday, Sept 5.  Our server, Francisco, was amazing!!  He always had a smile and provided friendly and efficient service throughout the meal.  Everyone was happy with their meal and we will definitely be back!
Horrible! Not a real fridays inside a musky old abandoned building. Also no specials no special fridays prices and most fridays favorites are NOT on the menu!!!! Do NOT go to this location

HORRIBLE would be an understatement!  I took my husband and my best friend here for their first times, this is not the same place it use to be. First off we waited over 5 min for someone to realize we were at the door waiting to be seated, when the server came she went to seat us and there were no clean tables we sat at the dirty table and had her wipe the table with us sitting in the booth. We ordered drinks right away because that was the reason behind coming in the first place we could drink with our meal. My husband didn't even drink the beer it was so flat and I swear my margarita was a Virgin margarita :/ that was after waiting over 20 min for them to come because the bartender "missed our order" we ordered food promptly after receiving drinks and waited over and hour for food!! And HOUR, mind you there is maybe 5 tables fill in the whole place. We opted leaving but as soon as we attempted the food was scurried right to us... We didn't see our waitress again after getting our food until I made a scene to receive my bill... Lucky I payed at all if you ask me. And I nor my family and friends will be back

So we decided to come in tonight. No one in the front to welcome or seat us, and I remembered them having a sign to seat ourselves one time so we did. Made eye contact with one of the servers while we selected a booth so we sat and waited for our menus. He never said "Hi" or smiled at us. 10 minutes go by and we never got out menus while he's walking around and talking to his coworker. Seeing that, we upped and walked out to go where customers were welcomed. If you decide to come to this place, go during the day.. maybe there will be more welcoming and positive servers then. After seeing the reviews and experiencing the rude staff. I suggest this place to undergo new management.

I've been here weekends, weeknights, lunch, dinner, happy hour, etc... you name it. Service has always been crappy! They take forever to send a waiter to greet you and even longer to bring your drinks and food out. Even when the restaurant is empty service is horrible! I can think of one time I got a great waitress. Food is bland and almost always over cooked. No flavor and burnt equals no fun! Happy hour drinks barely have any alcohol and too much ice! What the hell?! After a few being sent back, I got tired of telling them what was wrong. Tables are dirty, sticky and so are the seats. I always feel I have to clean them myself before I sit down.  Why do I keep coming back you ask? The Jack Daniels sauce! Thus the 2 stars. This is the only restaurant that I know serves it and I love it! LOL This used to be my happy hour spot with the girls since we love our JD's sauce but after giving them PLENTY of chances to improve, we're moving on. For the price of their food and drinks there are plenty of other restaurants that have better quality food and great service.  Btw, since my last visit there's a new manager and let's just say she's something that rhymes with "witch!" I can see why her employees don't seem to care about customer service. Bye bye favorite dipping sauce!
Excellent service good food not too busy and the bartenders are nice the parking lot is dark and not light well but overall it's a good place for drinks

I completely agree with Veronica C!  I keep coming back after crappy service. Evertime I have a horrible experience there and I come back months later because unbelievably they have some good food.  There are always many open tables, 4-5 hostesses (with unwelcoming personalities) who tell you 20 min wait for a table. Tonight we decided to wait because we thought it couldn't be that long as the place was empty.  We watch 5 separate parties walk away after being told it would be a 20-30 min wait.  The food is good. The problem has always clearly been the management. Not scheduling enough employees, too many hostesses doing nothing. It never changes.

Trust these reviews. My husband and I used to love going to TGIF for the food.  The service- poor. Everytime we walk through the door we wonder is the Host going smile or greet us this time? Usually they stare at us until we tell them there are two people standing in front of you that would like a table. We always feel awkward until we are seated.  Servers -average. With the exception of Dana. He is awesome. Very friendly and clearly a hard worker.  Just some advice for tgif carlsbad. You are getting paid to give great service. Just smile, greet and thank your customers and I'm sure you wouldn't only have 2 stars on YELP.

Worst experience ever! Came in at 11pm with 6 teenagers. Hardly anyone there. Ordered sides. Was told it would be 35 minutes...then 45 minutes...maybe more.  Restaurant was hard to find. Service was ridiculous. Left. Got food elsewhere in under ten minutes. And the In and Out was far cleaner! Avoid at all costs! If I could give this no star I would!!!!

We walk in in the restaurant is empty thought we would get good service since there wasn't any customers wrong sat for about ten minutes until a bartender acknowledged us and dropped off two menus or should I say threw two menus at our table and walked away didn't even greet us or anything. Five minutes later comes back and says what you want to drink I am like are u serious not even a welcome or anything. Stood up and said with that attitude we don't want anything to drink have a good night and walked out. Seriously if you don't like your job just quit please. Worst bartender ever.

We walked in, three parties before us waiting for tables. 20-30 min wait. I looked and the place was empty, big location but must have been short staffed. Employees were not outgoing at all. Food was ok. I got the French dip. Au jus was only half full, my daughters kids meal had more fries than I did. We saw at least six servers. So I'm not sure how short staffed they were. On good experiences I've had at other restaurants managers always came around to check on table, no manager came around. Server was pretty friendly. Mother in law said barrel chicken was too peppery and they did offer a substitute. Bathrooms were a disaster too.

So I walked into the restaurant and the first thing I saw was 2 cockroaches reproducing in a baby chair. Then I saw a server picking his nose and flick it. I think that's what's drawing these horny insects. Finally I go to use the powder room and there was a turd in the urinal. Kinda gross. But at least our server was nice and helpful

This place always disappoints and still I have given it multiple chances to prove me wrong. They're staff is horrible! I am so upset for words right now! They are careless, lack customer service and do not even reach the lowest level of customer service expectations. I will be contacting corporate.

Worst Friday's food ever had.  Had the French onion soup and chicken strip lunch.  Soup like dirty water, no seasonings. Had an entertainment book coupon.. didn't let us use.  Oh well.  Will not go back there again.  No wonder place was empty...

Not the Friday's experience that I hoped for. Yes the food was good but this place was so depressing I couldn't get out fast enough. Typical Friday's menu, steak was great. I never order anything without the delicious JackDaniels sauce.  This is located in the Carlsbad by the Sea Resort. If the atmosphere in the hotel is anything like this restaurant, I wouldn't recommend that either.  On a Friday night this place was a ghost town. No hostess, and the employees were just there to get by. No smiles, hardly any music. It was all just bland and depressing.  They either need to relocate or remodel.

We came in on Valentine's day to celebrate my hubby birthday . There wait time was 25 minutes and they got us in 20 minutes.  We ordered are drinks they where good and took 10 minutes  . When we place are order , we order appetizers and entre at the same time . Are food came first , then are appetizer . They bought us  are side late . They sang to him . Which was sweet . Food was good .

No I know why this place has 2.5 stars terrible service not our waiter but the fact the management can't schedule enough staff for a large party! Waited 45 mins for drinks and an hour for 1/3 of the meals so we couldn't eat together!
